summary: The 'Safeguarding Department of Veterans Affairs Dependent Education Benefits Act of 2025' amends Title 38 of the United States Code to reinstate Post-9/11 educational assistance benefits for spouses and dependent children of veterans who had their benefits terminated due to dependent-abuse offenses. The bill outlines the conditions for reinstatement, application procedures, and definitions of key terms, including 'dependent-abuse offense' and 'covered individual.' It mandates regulations and review processes to ensure fairness and trauma-informed support for victims while preventing duplication of benefits.
